page.title: 08THE MIDDLE SCHOOL-1.Building
page.content: Our school is an 8-12yrs.mixed County Middle School which is situated to the East of Baddesley Ensor village in the parish of Grendon.The building,which is an 'H' shape,is 73 years old and has two storeys. There are 18 rooms altogether:- 6 classrooms,science/cookery room, a group room,a music room,a craftroom, a maths/television room,a library, a hall, which is used for assemblies, PE. lessons and school meals,a kitchen a staffroom and three offices. Most of the school is heated by oil fired central heating but the staffroom and offices have coal fires. The school has one colour television, one video recorder,one microcomputer, two radio/cassette players and one slide projector.There are two cookers in the cookery room and a pottery kiln in the craft room.
